Create an SMS Message in Marketing Cloud Growth

Create an SMS message for your Marketing Cloud Growth campaigns and reach your customers directly on their mobile devices. Use SMS messaging to promote something new, follow-up on an ongoing transaction, and more.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition and the Salesforce Message Credits - SMS add-on


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or edit content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

any CMS workspace contributor role


To publish or unpublish content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

a CMS workspace contributor role of content admin or content manager

Not sure where to start? Check out these basics for creating content in Marketing Cloud.

While you write your SMS message, the preview updates on the canvas. If you exceed the maximum length for a single message, the number of messages increases. SMS messages are concatenated, or combined, into one long message, but they still count as multiple sends. When the recipient’s carrier doesn’t support concatenation, multiple messages are split up.

From your marketing workspace, create or open an SMS message.
Give your message a title for internal use.
Set the Message Purpose to Promotional or Transactional depending on your campaign goals.
Enter your message content in the Message field.
To personalize your message, click Add Merge Field and choose any Unified Individual merge field.
To comply with consent and privacy regulations, write clear opt-out instructions and specify an opt-out keyword in the message body.
Save your work.

Now you can preview and test your SMS message. Then, publish it to make the message available to send in a campaign. You can’t activate a campaign flow that contains an SMS message until the message is published.

Working with SMS Messages in Marketing Cloud Growth
After you create your SMS message, preview it and send a test to a mobile device. To make significant changes to a published SMS message or prevent it from sending in a campaign, unpublish it.
SMS Message Length in Marketing Cloud Growth
To avoid sending multiple messages and using extra message credits, be mindful of the length of your SMS message. When you exceed the character limit for a single message, the message count increases. Using non-GSM characters, links, or merge fields increases message length.
Opt-Out Keywords for SMS Messages in Marketing Cloud Growth
To meet consent and privacy regulations, your recipients must know how to opt-out of SMS messages. In your messages, provide specific opt-out keywords and clear instructions for using them. Include keywords in promotional or transactional messages every time you send.
